Deficiency Narrative: There were  expired driver licenses in 4 or 6 employee files reviewed.
Two first aid kits were inspected and found to be missing thermometers.
Correction Narrative: On 9-15-25 the administrator submitted via email photos of the missing items required to be in all first aid kits. Staff will be training on the standard by 9-16-25.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was not able to provide records to show that a fire  or emergency relocation drills have been conducted for calendar 2025 for two cottages.
Correction Narrative: The administrator submitted a corrective action plan   addressing the citation. A refresher training was conducted with the Director of Maintenance on 7-9-25. The Director will be tasked with calendaring the evacuation drills in advance for the year. In addition, the Campus Ministries Assistant will be the designee tasked with providing a second calendar check and distributing forms.

Deficiency Narrative: Five preliminary service plans have been reviewed. The plans do not address supervision.
Correction Narrative: The administrator submitted a corrective action plan to address the citation. The Director of Social Services will communicate and re-train the HFC caseworkers regarding including supervision in the child's preliminary service plan to help caregivers adjust and guide in supervision and ensure safety of the children. On 7-10-25 the training to place.

Deficiency Narrative: There was a hole on the side of the wall of Hoipe Cottage that required maintenance.
Correction Narrative: The operation has repaired the whole on the wall. The quartery maintenance sheet was completed.

Deficiency Narrative: Two smoke alarms were not porperly maintained in 2 seperated cottages.
Correction Narrative: The two smoke alarms in the cottages have been repaired by the operaiton and the quartely maintenance report was completed.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member made a comment of hitting a child in care with a shoe.
Correction Narrative:
A corrective action plan was submitted via email for this investigation on 11/25/24. STCH Ministries Homes for Children will re-train staff on appropriate ways to speak to children in care during the December 3, 2024, staff training. In addition, as of December 1, 2024, staff member in question will no longer be employed at STCH Ministries.

During the follow-up visit on 12/4/24, the following documents were provided by the operation:
Training staff signatures on 12/3/24; Child Rights Policy; Resignation Letter of staff member; Cottage House Parent and Child placement for December 2024; and Child Abuse and Prevention Policy.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers forgot a child in care at home during an outing.
Correction Narrative: STCH Ministries Homes for Children has submitted a Corrective Action Plan via email regarding notification on 11/1/2023 standard 748.685 (a), to assure compliance with this standard. HFC Administration will be communicating to HFC Childcare staff on November 12th regarding caregiver responsibility for ensuring each child is accounted for prior to leaving the campus by having a cottage census check prior to leaving the cottage for outings.

Deficiency Narrative: Preliminary service plan did not address supervision needed for children in care.
Correction Narrative:
The operation has submitted a corrective action plan for this standard via email. STCH Ministries Homes for Children Corrective Action Plan regarding notification on 11/1/2024 for standard 748.1331.
The Director of Social Services will communicate with HFC Caseworkers to included supervision in the childs service plan, to help caregiver adjust and guide to the type of supervision required and ensure the safety of the children in their care.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers would not provide supervision checks as needed.
Correction Narrative:
STCH Ministries Homes for Children responded via email for the compliance date on 8-20-24. Staff will participate in supervision training on August 20th, that will discuss level of supervision ensuring childs safety.
________________

The operation provided re-training on supervision on 8-20-24. It was discussed how staff will be providing auditory and visual awareness to children in placement and be able to intervene when needed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was not moved cottages after disclosing she was being bullied by another child in care.
Correction Narrative:
STCH Ministries Homes for Children responded via email on 8-20-24 for compliance for this standard. STCH Ministries caseworker and counselor staff will have monthly cottage meetings and HFC administration will follow up to discuss placement needs.  

___________________________________________

During the inspection the operation provided log for trainings and discussion on child and staff meetings biweekly as well as overall environmental staffing.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member grabbed the arm of a child in care for redirection when the child threw the finger.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator discussed with house parents the importance of not grabbing or touching a child in care in a negative manner or for corrections. The assigned Case Manager also met with both house parents and the victim discussing the issue and proper ways to use de-escalation avoiding any form of contact from either the child and/or house parents.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident report did not have any documentation of adults present during the incident.
Correction Narrative:
Reference to inspection #4059024 
The Administrator directed all staff to complete additional on line water safety training. Two house parents were interviewed and confirmed they completed the water safety training and also do annual water safety training. 

The author of the SIR document was not familiar with the form and unintentionally left off the adults present on the day of the incident. The administrator provided the names of the adult present that day. The administrator also sent out correspondence to staff underlining the importance of documenting who is present and their roles during the incident.

Deficiency Narrative: The Service Plan indicated a youth involved required constant supervision. In addition, change in psychotropic medication also indicated the youth required supervision as well for any health issues.
Correction Narrative:
Response from administrator: STCH Ministries Homes for Children Corrective Action Plan regarding investigation on 08/11/2023. 748.685 (a) (4) Caregiver responsibility  providing the level of supervision necessary to ensure each childs safety and well-being.

The following is the corrective action taken to assure compliance with this standard. We will monitor psychotropic medication for triggers for the safety of all children in care. Communicating when a child has a change of psychotropic medication to staff will occur prior to the change. 
STCH Ministries Homes for Children staff will be aware of service plans of children who require heightened supervision by discussing with Primary houseparents, respite houseparents, caseworker, and counselor at weekly cottage staffing.

Deficiency Narrative: The serious incident report did not document the names of all adults involved and their role in the relation to the child.
Correction Narrative:
STCH Ministries Homes for Children will be Director of Social Services will be staffing with the Social Services department that Serious Incident Documents must include names of all adults involved and their role in relation to the child(ren).
Additionally, our Quality Improvement Specialist will be viewing Serious Incident Documents for compliance with DFPS Minimum standards after being documented.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the serious incident report there were two deficiencies that were noted, all names of the children involved and adults that were present were not included in the report as required.
Correction Narrative: STCH will be holding a training to all employees to retrain them on how to fill out incident reports. They will make sure to include all information in the future.

Deficiency Narrative: Three charts evaluated did not contain the required information for religion.
Two records reviewed did not have up to date TB screenings.
Correction Narrative: STCH Ministries Homes for Children has update our intake checklist to accommodate this standard including Dental Exam. Two children needing TB exam has been scheduled for Monday October 19th.
